unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked what's the deal with all these stomach issues ppl are having lately. Honestly, it's pretty common, especially with our crazy lifestyles and all the yummy but questionable street food we eat. Gastroenterology, which is basically the study of your digestive system (like, from your mouth all the way down), is seeing a LOT of patients these days.

unnormalised: One of the biggest culprits is acidity. You eat some spicy biryani from that famous place near your office in Gurgaon, and bam! Heartburn hits you like a truck. My colleague, Rohan, keeps popping antacids like they're candy. He says Dr. Sharma at Max Hospital told him to cut down on the oily stuff. Easier said than done, right?

unnormalised: Another common thing is Irritable Bowel Syndrome, or IBS. It's a real pain, causing bloating, gas, and inconsistent bowel movements. Aisha from my gym was diagnosed with it a few months ago. She's been following a special diet, avoiding gluten and lactose, and it seems to be helping, but it's def a big lifestyle change. She mentioned some test called a colonoscopy which she had at the age of 35 which was quite expensive.

unnormalised: Then there's the more serious stuff, like ulcers or even cancer. But don't panic! Catching these things early is key. Regular check-ups, especially if you have a family history, are super important. Hospitals like AIIMS in Delhi have really good Gastroenterology departments with experienced doctors. They can run tests like endoscopies and biopsies to figure out what's going on. A close relative was tested by a doctor with a qualification of DM in gastroenterology.
